name: U Kang
content: U Kang U Kang Professor Department of Computer Science and Engineering Interdisciplinary Program in Artificial Intelligence Data Mining Lab Seoul National University 1 Gwanak-ro, Gwanak-gu, Seoul, Republic of Korea 08826 Email: ukang at snu.ac.kr Office: Room 301-502 I am a Professor in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering at Seoul National University. I am also a Head Professor in the Interdisciplinary Program in Artificial Intelligence at Seoul National University. Here is my short biography and full Curriculum Vitae. I lead the Data Mining Lab in Department of Computer Science and Engineering. I advise DeepTrade, a company providing state-of-the-art financial AI technologies. (Announcement) If you are interested in an internship in our lab, please read this before sending an application. What's New (May 2022) Our paper "DPar2: Fast and Scalable PARAFAC2 Decomposition for Irregular Dense Tensors" won the Best Research Paper Award (Honorable Mention) at ICDE 2022. (Aug. 2021) Our paper "Fast and Memory-Efficient Tucker Decomposition for Answering Diverse Time Range Queries" won the Best Research Paper Award at KDD 2021. (May 2020) Our paper "Accurate News Recommendation Coalescing Personal and Global Temporal Preferences" won the Best Student Paper Award at PAKDD 2020. (Feb 2019) I gave a tutorial on Lightweight Deep Learning with Model Compression in IEEE BigComp 2019. (Nov 2018) I won the 10-Year Highest Impact Paper Award from IEEE International Conference on Data Mining (ICDM). (Feb 2018) PegasusN, a new version of Pegasus graph mining system is released. (Dec 2016) I won the 1st Young Information Scientist Award from Korean Institute of Information Scientists and Engineers. (Aug 2013) I won the 2013 SIGKDD Doctoral Dissertation Award, Honorable Mention. (Mar 2013) I won the 2013 New Faculty Award from Microsoft Research Asia. Courses Current Semester Fall 2025, M1522.001400: Introduction to Data Mining Previous Semesters Spring 2025, M1522.000900: Data Structure Fall 2024, M1522.001400: Introduction to Data Mining Spring 2024, M1522.000900: Data Structure Spring 2024, M2177.008600: Introduction to AI Fall 2023, M3309.000200: Reinforcement Learning Spring 2023, M1522.000900: Data Structure Spring 2023, M2177.004900: Introduction and Practice of IoT, AI, and Big Data Fall 2022, M2177.003000: Advanced Data Mining Fall 2022, M1522.001400: Introduction to Data Mining Spring 2021, M3309.000200: Reinforcement Learning Spring 2021, M1522.001400: Introduction to Data Mining Fall 2020, M2177.003000: Advanced Data Mining Fall 2020, M1522.000900: Data Structure Spring 2020, M2177.004900: Introduction and Practice of IoT, AI, and Big Data Fall 2019, M1522.000900: Data Structure Fall 2019, M2177.003000: Advanced Data Mining Spring 2019, M1522.001400: Introduction to Data Mining Spring 2019, M1522.001600: Reinforcement Learning (Topics in Big Data Analytics) Fall 2018, M1522.000900: Data Structure Fall 2018, M1522.001600: Advanced Deep Learning (Topics in Big Data Analytics) Spring 2018, M1522.001400: Introduction to Data Mining Spring 2018, 4190.773: Optimization for Machine Learning (Topics in Artificial Intelligence) Fall 2017, M1522.000900: Data Structure Fall 2017, M1522.001600: Advanced Deep Learning (Topics in Big Data Analytics) Spring 2017, M1522.001400: Introduction to Data Mining Spring 2017, M1522.001600: Deep Learning (Topics in Big Data Analytics) Fall 2016, M1522.000900: Data Structure Fall 2016, 4190.209: Computer Engineering Seminar Spring 2016, M1522.001400: Introduction to Data Mining Fall 2015, M1522.000900: Data Structure Research Interests My research interests are large-scale Data Mining and Machine Learning. I develop core methods in AI and data science for 1) predictive modeling and anaylyzing real world data (e.g., graphs, tensors, time series, text, etc.), and 2) fast/adaptive inference and learning. Applications include recommender system, financial AI, industrial machine learning, social network, and anomaly detection. Deep Learning and Machine Learning Model compression (Lightweight model construction, LLM (large language model) compression, and On-device AI) Reinforcement learning for real-world problems Graphs and Tensors Graph neural network Patterns/models from graphs/tensors, and scalable analysis using GPU and distributed systems Recommender / Question-Answering (QA) Systems Diversified and accurate recommendation for news, videos, e-commerce, and finance Personalized QA system, AI agent with LLM, and trustworthy LLM Financial Artificial Intelligence (AI) Time series prediction and classification
